item.title: Background Photo + 80% Dark Overlay.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: It's easy to add a background image for the entire card, plus make text more legible by adding an overlay across the background with simple utility classes. These are all generated from the theme's variables!

item.title: Blog - Rich View
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Our Newsroom

Keep up to date with what we're working on! Landkit is an ever evolving theme with regular updates.
Tags:
Design Product UX Resources

Latest Stories

Here’s what we've been up to recently.

View all

Case Studies

In-depth looks at our work.

View all

Spending Time Outside the Office with Coworkers Is Great for Productivity.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Duis nec condimentum quam. Fusce pellentesque faucibus lorem at viverra. Integer at feugiat odio. In placerat euismod risus proin erat purus.
Adolfo Hess

2019-05-02

Working in Cafes Doesn’t Inspire You. It Kills Your Output and Costs Money.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Duis nec condimentum quam. Fusce pellentesque faucibus lorem at viverra. Integer at feugiat odio. In placerat euismod risus proin erat purus.
Ab Hadley

2019-05-02

Popular Stories

Here’s what’s big in the past week!

Read More

Get our stories delivered

From us to your inbox weekly.

item.title: Blog - Showcase
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We want to showcase all
the rich blog post options.

How you use Landkit's blog cards is up to you! Our design begins with atomic elements which are easily combined to create rich blog post components.

Horizontal articles

These span the grid's entire width with several options.

Vertical articles

These can be split into smaller grid sizes, though we recommend half or thirds

Get our stories delivered

From us to your inbox weekly.

item.title: Background Photo + Gradient Overlay.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: This blog card example shows a background image, but instead of an even wash across the entire background, it's a gradient from right to left controlled by another simple utility class.

item.title: Photo on Top + 50% Width.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: The markup for vertical articles is the same for a half and thirds split, it's controlled with columns.

item.title: Background Photo + Primary Overlay
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: Background photos are super easy to add and overlays can be added with utilities for legibility.

item.title: Background Photo + 30% Dark Overlay
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: A much lighter overlay work on darker photos, and is easy to control with utilities.

item.title: Photo on Top + 33.3% Width.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: The markup for this card is identical to that for the 50% Width article above.

item.title: All Text Card.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: Notice how this card stays the same height as its siblings and this text is vertically centered (at desktop sizes). This keeps layouts looking consistent no matter what type of content occupies each sibling card.

item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Using Unsplash to improve your listing visibility
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: Using free stock photos of your surrounding areas can skyrocket your popularity.

item.title: Photos should appeal to a sense of adventure
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: Cozy vibes are out and this summer you should focus on making customer's feel brave.

item.title: It's the little touches that make memories.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: Once you have your rental posted, you should focus on how you can differentiate your home with little touches. Chocolates, specialty coffee, fast wifi, nice toiletries, or a personal note. Small touches can make a huge difference.

item.title: Remote Work is the Future, but Should You Go Remote?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Photo on Right.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.excerpt:encoded: This is the body text of the blog post to give visitors an idea of what the post is about beyond just the title. It can be a long snippet, a short snippet, whatever you prefer the size of card and description to be.
